intro: Halosicyos ragonesei, commonly known as the Ragonese morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to blue flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and twining. Halosicyos ragonesei is adapted to arid environments, with deep roots that allow it to survive in rocky, coastal soils.
